reviewText: As described..very light weight bag.. i like it

Very happy with the product.
 To me it is very necessary.

 Thank you

Despite the description, this is not a school bag.  You won't be fitting all your books and laptop inside.  It's too small for that.  It's a backpack purse.  It will fit things that normally go into a medium purse.

I needed another backpack purse and this one fit the bill.  It is so soft and supple.  It's comfortable to wear.  I was afraid things might fall out of the drawstring closure, but that closure also has a snap button and a flap that snaps closed over that.  Nothing falls out.  Inside is one large compartment, a zippered pocket, and two open pockets.  I can fit all my essentials inside (Kindle Voyager, keys, phone) and secure the wallet.  Nice.

Everyone has commented on the strong scent from the backpack.  Yes, it's strong, and it lasts for days and days.  My husband said it smelled like shoe polish.  It does eventually dissipate.  After about a week or so, I didn't notice it at all.

This product was provided for review by Avber.

I received this for reviewing purposes so I had to enlist the aid of my sister in law who is going to be using it.

The bag/backpack is constructed from real lambskin leather which is soft, supple and sturdy. The size is ideal for a young mother of three, small enough to be practical but large enough to accommodate all the things a woman keeps in her bag and the things a mother knows her kids may need. Yes, it is still an unsolved mystery to us how you ladies pack so much in your bags! Nevertheless, it has four inner pockets for your cellphone and small objects and an ample main compartment for everything else, including a tablet, as it is lined to protect electronic devices form scratching.

What needs further mentioning is the secure way it closes at the top, employing a draw cord (also in leather), a top magnetic clasp as well as another magnetic clasp securing the top flap. Unless one drops it in a body of water, your things will be safe from the elements.

I think this beautiful leather backpack can cater the needs of most women, from mothers to students, while the black color with the silver details compliment most casual dressing styles.

RECOMMENDED.

I received this product free for review but as always, despite receiving a free product I'm perfectly candid in my review. See my video for the real details but the highlights are: * Seems well constructed with shoulder straps and a top cinch closure * Jingles in a wonderful manner * Essentially four different pockets including the large center one. * Soft exterior feel. * Metal decorations have a few flaws in the finish but nothing terribly noticeable. * Big enough for a tablet computer but not for a full-size notebook. PS: I hope my review was helpful. If it was not, then please let me know what I left out that you'd want to know. I always aim to improve.
summary: Nice stylish bag/backpack with a fair number of pockets.

reviewText:
Free sample provided for review and evaluation.

This is a good 'purse' backpack.  I love to carry them while shopping because I can hold my purse AND have my hands free.  This one is pretty secure- it has a nice snap, a tie, and then the flap comes over and snaps again.

It does smell quite strongly when it arrives, but it is leather and any leather is going to have some dying and processing that brings a bit of a smell.  After airing out, it became much less noticeable.  The leather is soft and supple, and the color is a true black.  It's a very nice square patchwork pattern.  It has a row of black paillettes across the front for decoration.

Some of the stitch settings could be smaller- on the inside of the bag, for instance, on the lining, and also where the paillettes are sewn on, the stitch setting is a bit looser than I would expect from a leather item in this price range.  This could cause an inside pocket or decorative item to come off in time with a bit of wear and tear.

Other than a few areas of less than optimal stitching, the bag looks great, and it holds items securely and is comfortable to wear.  The straps adjust so it should fit any lady.  I'm a plus size and can wear this bag comfortably.
summary: Very comfortable to wear, and a nice secure closure at the top

reviewText:
When I lived in Japan, this style of bag was very popular among young women in Tokyo. Various elements of the design made it ideal for a culture in which people spent a lot of their days on public transportation or walking. The size is ideal to give it enough capacity to carry everything you need for the day - like a large purse and it can be slung over your shoulder or carried on your back. While it will not accommodate a full-size laptop, it will fit a tablet easily as well as whatever necessities you might want to put in it. The snap closure makes it easy to open and close and you can moderate the opening size using the drawstring at the top. The straps are easy to adjust and hold firm once you set them to the size that you'd like.

The leather on this is very soft. The construction feels very good, but mine had a very minor stitching error on the top flap (the line was stopped and restarted adjacent - there was also an errant thread loop). This was nothing big, but it's worth mentioning. The only problem for me is that the decorative edging makes a gentle tinkling noise every time you move the bag or walk with it. It's not super loud, but it can be distracting. This may be best used for someone who either doesn't mind the sound or who isn't walking a lot of the time.

This is a very attractive and nicely functional backpack which serves as an excellent large-size handbag as well as a backpack.

Note: I received this product in exchange for my assessment.
summary: soft leather and a great design

reviewText:
This bag is quite attractive, and seems very quality made.  It also has to be the finest lambskin leather I have felt.  Butter soft and extremely flexible. It arrived in a sealed bag that when opened let out quite a strong scent that to me was very pleasant, but has since dissipated quite a bit.  (You can still smell it close up though like any fine leather). as far as this being functional, its pretty small for a backpack.  Not really seriously for school despite its title, but very stylish and functional uses of a lighter nature.  It expands to a nice size and has a couple of special compartments inside for a phone, keys, etc. It could easily pass as a pocketbook that you were on your back.  Overall I can't help but be impressed with this bag, and so is the young woman that I gave it too.  In fact she loves it.  For the looks, quality of the lambskin, price, and overall nice workmanship on it, I highly recommend it..

Free sample provided in exchange for a fair and honest review..
summary: Beautiful, Quality, Ultra Soft Lambskin Bag...

reviewText:
Very soft leather. This is a really nice-looking bag, with a cool patchwork look. It's also comfortable to wear. As far as using it as a school backpack, that's not appropriate. It says it can fit a notebook, but I didn't find that to be true. The only way you can get away with a standard 8.5" x 11" spiral notebook is if you leave the drawstring on top totally open, which looks weird and doesn't protect the notebook. As you can see from the product photo, it's meant to cinch in on top, which makes the top three inches or so too narrow for a notebook.

What it IS appropriate for is a tablet, and/or regular pocketbook contents-- wallet, sunglasses, brush/comb, water bottle, etc. Could also be a good plane carry-on if you just need a few things. What I see it as perfect for are the outings I take with my daughter to the zoo, park, etc... I don't have to worry about carrying an extra bag that I'd need to put down every time I want to take a picture of her or do something active.

It has a strong scent; I'm hoping it will air out after I've had it longer. (Update: it has.)

The coolest part for me is the fact that I now jingle when I walk. I think it's really quirky and cheerful... youthful. It's a gentle sound, not overbearing. But yes, the little metal decorations do clink against each other and make a little jingle with each step. I'm sure that would not be everyone's cup of tea, but I like it!

reviewText:
If you are experienced with binding, then buy a size lower than recommended. Trust me.

This binder is really comfortable. It will not get you perfectly flat like some other methods might; however, it is perfect for everyday use. It isn't itchy, and it is breathable. It binds satisfactorily.

Tbh, I will use a different method for special occasions when I want to wear a fitted suit. But, for everyday, this binder works fine.

Quality to cost comparison though, this binder is over-priced and is over-rated. I'd go try a cheaper binder before you set your heart and mind on this one.
summary: Buy Size Below, Wearable Everyday, Buy Cheaper

Everyone was asked to wear a super hero shirt to the funeral and the whole county chose to wear one to work or out and about in support of the family, the children involved and most importantly the precious child who gave his life.
This shirt was a symbol of unity and hope and I ask that anyone who orders it to take a moment, hug your family and think of Jacob and the community of Anderson County SC.

reviewText:
This set is so cute! It's made out of polyester and has a small tag that says "hand made". The inside of the "blue plaid" pattern that I bought is lined with orange. Really adds a contemporary look.

It is not a cheap set. Very well made. It also has a loop and button hook on the "father's" tie. So definitely a higher end set. Which is good for me since I bought this as a gift for my brother and his young son. I also like that the "child's" tie is not a clip on. It is an adjustable neck band.

So it's very much a "grown up set" - not a cheap adult tie to match the kid's one. Note: the adult tie is a narrow design. Not a wide one, in case anyone had a preference.

Very happy with this purchase! Which I received at a discount for my honest and unbiased review.

reviewText:
I sure love this set!  I purchased the Iceman Blue and the yellow striped design for my husband and son.  The quality is fantastic, and looks and feels great.  My son just loved dressing up like Daddy for church yesterday, and they both looked so sharp in their new ties.  Another great feature is that they are machine washable, Stain & Wrinkle Resistant! The little boys tie is adjustable, so you can fit it just right around his neck.  I was quite impressed with the quality, and will be back for more sets!

This product was provided at a discount for an honest evaluation.  I definitely recommend ties from this company.  They are great quality!

I have been looking everywhere for matching ties for my son & grandson, and these are perfect! I thought I would be able to just walk into a store and find matching ties, and I have been to several stores and nothing. I chose the blue & red striped ties because they will be able to be used for several different occasions.

* Perfect Match
* We have received many compliments for some some simple pictures that I took of the two of them wearing them, I can't wait to get professional pictures done of Dad & Son.
* From what I can tell they seem to be made of quality material, it's not something that will be worn daily or weekly so I can see these lasting a long time ( Typical Grandma I'm hoping that these will be passed along to the next generation as well!)

* I did obtain these at a discounted rate in exchange for an honest review. Thank you for reading!
summary: Can't find matching ties in a store.... well here you go!!!  Perfect for now & generations to come!

reviewText:
The set of ties looks absolutely beautiful and is made out of high quality material. The ties do not feel cheap. These ties are very well made, everything you would expect from a very nice, expensive tie.

I bought these because my favorite color is aqua, and my husband's favorite color is navy blue. We went to a portrait studio and had a birthday photo session, with my husband and son wearing these ties. The ties really made the photos!

reviewText: For the price you can't beat it. These are sunglasses that I don't have to worry about beating up a little bit, they are sturdy. A little tight on my head when they first came but they've loosened up a little bit since.

They have larger lenses than the Wayfarers I've had in the past. My biggest problem with them is the blue tint you see when looking through them, all warm colors are extremely muted. You would think the lenses would have a warm tint if anything based on their color. Spend an extra $5 and get the zeroUV brand instead, I've bought them many times and enjoyed every pair.

For what I paid I can't expect too much, but frankly these are garbage unless you're only wearing them once or twice. Don't fit my head very well and cause a headache from pressure if worn for too long.

To be honest, the look very goofy and way too big, even on an adult (matte black and red-orange lens). I would never wear these in public, but maybe when driving since they block out a lot of sun. The hinge on these are fragile and break easily, and need to be fixed with glue or something of the sort. They are fun little glasses to mess around with or use as driving or as "disposable" glasses (since they are like $5), but not for everyday use. Get a pair of sunglasses at a gas station or something for like $12 that will last you years.

Someone had mentioned leg warmers worked well to keep baby warm during a hospital stay so I found these. They worked perfectly. The material is incredibly soft, and even after washing a few times they still remain that way. He is a little on the large size for a 3 month old, not fat, just about the size of a 6 month old. They were a tiny bit long but I just bunched them a little and they were perfect, covering his whole little leg :)

These super soft (due to bamboo) and colorful leg warmers are very practical and fun for baby and parents during tummy time and diaper changes. Minus one star for the brown and white argyle pair for shredding a little on the corners after one wash. Maybe the company could mail me another one of that item? Then I could tell if it was just a bad batch for that kind. Overall super cute, fit well for babies only and soft!

This skirt is GORGEOUS! It does run a little small, but I read the reviews ahead of time and ordered accordingly. I am 5'7.5" with an athletic build at 155lbs-- my waist is 26" and the largest area of my hips/booty is 42". I am usually a medium skirt if the skirt is tight throughout; if it's a skater dress or skirt where it only needs to be tight at the waist, I'm usually a small or a 4. So since the reviews said it ran small, I ordered a Medium and it's perfect. The material feels pretty good; it looks exactly like the picture.  It got 4 stars instead of 5 from me because it's not super great quality-- in the back there's a crooked seem that comes out and is a bit noticeable (I found it when I was ironing).  However, I think any shirt I wear with it will cover the weird seam, so it's not a big deal.  You will need to iron or steam this skirt though as the material came very wrinkled. It is lined to about 2/3 the length of the skirt. Here's a couple pictures of it when I first took it out of the box and tried it on (before ironing).  When I wear it for the first time, I will update the pictures.  Sorry they aren't the best quality, the lighting in my apartment is weird. Hope this helps!!
summary: Everyone's right-- runs a little small but is ADORABLE!

I've got to say that I was happy to receive my items when I first got them. I ordered this infant aviator hat and the bumble bee infant knit and they seemed great at first glance. But after looking back at my order I started noticing little things that bugged me. We're getting ready for our newest addition to the family this August 2016 and being in the airline industry we want to have some cool aviation related pictures taken of our baby girl once she arrives. A few days after receiving this item it kept bugging me that I'd seen these knits elsewhere and then my wife chimed in and said "yeah, they're on Etsy".

The seller of these knits looks like they purchased a template that's for sale by another seller on that site and borrowed some of the pictures. The knit helmet runs a little big for an infant, although done very well as far as being soft and complete, the design doesn't quite match up with what you see in the images. One thing I liked was that the goggles looked deep due to the layering of the stitching between the red and grey rim for the goggles, but what I actually received looked less recreation and more cartoon like. If you look at the picture you'll notice the inner goggle is much smaller than what you expect to receive, which makes it look bug eyed. Like some other reviewers noted, it's just not what's pictured.

For $7.00 I can't really complain, but those infant pictures are a one in a lifetime opportunity to get just the right image, and I don't want to be staring at a picture thinking how I should've just ordered the right one. I would not have ordered these if I had seen the actual image of the items I would receive.
summary: Looks great in the images, not quite what you will receive though.

The reviews on here are accurate.
This wallet is good enough but is seriously under-engineered and awkward. I bought the bigger one, it is an original and not a fake. This wallet is poorly designed and cannot hold too much of anything without quickly reaching its capacity. I had to omit several cards and photos because the wallet could not hold them.
The clasp that holds the wallet closed is extremely fragile and will bend if the wallet is closed on a bill or coin. Kind of understandable considering that the clasp is very thin metal, but still. If you do not deliberately watch the mechanism as you close it, this could happen to you. And even then, the clasp itself, tasked with holding all your valuables together, is woefully frail.
Ergonomically speaking the compartments need to be switched so that the credit cards are on one side and the bill storage is on the other. If you put more than 5 bills into the compartment, it won't close because the cc holder gets in the way.
They seem like a good company though and offered to replace my wallet when I informed them of the clasp issue (which I fixed myself). Decided that I will get another wallet when this one fails again (which it will, I am afraid).
This wallet isn't the top of the line, but it gets the job done. A very solid build that will last me for years to come.

I've had this wallet for quite some time now and all I can say about it is, 'it's practical enough' .
At the end of the day I guess it gets the job done . I replaced it with my classic leather wallet, which I still keep in my car though .
..
With that being said, this thing has a few major flaws.
First of all, the poor built quality . When I first received it, it looked right , but it didn't feel right .
If You keep it in your pockets with keys, it will get scratched up in no time . Same goes for when you drop it.
Secondly, if you put smaller and larger Euro coins together in the coin compartment ( 5 cents, 2 cents etc ..) , it's very likely that they will get stuck !
And getting them out can be very tricky, especially when You're trying not to scratch the thing up .

So, overall this wallet is ridiculously overpriced .
It looks, feels and performs more like a 15 - 20 $ product .

I have to give it 3 stars because, like I said, it does get the job done .

reviewText: Quite the handsome little tie! Good material and pretty strong, my boys go through ties pretty fast so finding a good one that stands up to a few uses is a good find! I found this on a deals website in return for an honest review!

We purchased the 12" for our 4 year old son. When it came in, he was so excited that he put it on himself and wore it around with just a t-shirt. His little fingers were able to manipulate the clasp himself to undo and then again to clasp. I could appreciate that as I know sometimes it's a battle to get him dressed while also trying to get his baby brother and myself ready to get out the door when we have someplace to be. The ease of use means he can at least put it on himself, then if need be, I can tighten and put under his collar while I get him in or out of the car.
What I really like about this is that it IS NOT a clip on tie. Clip on ties tend to have a cheap plastic clip or a tough metal one that is a bear to get open. They then seem to weigh some collars down. That wasn't the case with this tie. This was lightweight but still had quality fabric and construction. I like that it has the wrap around fabric too, to complete the look and appear as if we have it together and managed to knot a full out tie on a busy preschooler.
The colors are true to the images in the listing. What I didn't notice before buying was that there is a small image of a plane at the end of the tie. I though this was a very nice and classy touch along with the orange inner lining of the tie that can be seen peeking out of the back of the face of the tie (wherre the tag is). My son immediately picked up on the little plane and pointed it out to anyone and everyone that commented on his tie. Admittedly, when we opened the package, he put it on and wore it with his t-shirt. Although not the fashion choice I would have made, the color in his shirt matched the tie so kudos to him. We let him wear it to the grocery store and running other errands. I couldn't believe how many folks noticed and complimented him and us on the tie. No fewer than a half dozen folks had pleasantries to give regarding this tie.
My husband and I were actually so impressed that we think we may pick up a few other in the other avilable colorways. Our son actually enjoys wearing the tie, and conveniently he loves his polo shirts the best...so he'll be one dapper little man heading back to preschool this fall.

**We recieved this tie at a discounted price in exchange for our honest feedback and review. No other compensation was received and all thoughts and opinions expressed in this review are our own.**

This is just what I was looking for.  As a Mom of 4 boys I've seen a lot of kids ties and I think this one is about perfect.  Nice heavy weight material, lays flat, and the airplaine is a cute touch.  The skinny tie style looks adorable on my little guy. :)  I love the way this tie attaches.  Zip up ties tend to have the zippers go bad, which means they don't stay up on their own.  Clip on ties come apart when grabby hands pull on them, and it is hard to center them on the dress shirt.  This, with the clip in the back, looks great and stays in place.  I ordered the 12" for my 3 year old and although he's a skinny kid I had no problem getting a snug and proper fit.  Very pleased.  I purchased this tie at a discount in exchange for my opinion.  I make it a policy not to review items I wouldn't feel comfortable buying at their regular price.  The price on this tie is in line with what I've paid for other ties - I plan to pick up a few more for Christmas presents, great fabric selections.

Other than the set being lose I have no complaints. The ring has not tarnished at all which is a big plus for me I am very rough on jewelry.

There were no discolorations on the skin from water which is also a big plus for me.

I gave this four star due to the fact the set was lose. Other than that this is a nice little ring. It has worn well and if the sellers jewelry is the same quality as this one I would purchase more items from the store. You can't expect every item to be perfect. Even tho it has its flaw this is still worth wearing.

reviewText: Super cute and soft. Fit true to size. I ordered the Bubble Dot and think its adorable, the colors are a little lighter than the pic. Love the pinks, baby blue and light green. There is no hard sole, the bottom of the sock is the same soft fabric as the top with dots of rubber to keep them from slipping.  Perfect for reading a book or watching a movie. I do wear them out on the porch, but that is the extent of outside wear. (You would feel it if you stepped on a rock.) The inside has a cozy fleece lining. Not too warm to make your feet sweaty, perfect over socks. I will probably wear a warmer slipper in the cold of winter, but these are great for fall or for cuddling up under a blanket. I will also wear other slippers if I will be on my feet for a long time, because you can feel the rubber dots a little through the bottom. Could be easlily rolled up and put in a tote or handbag when you go to a friend's house to slip on after taking off your shoes. Or at a relatives on Thanksgiving or Christmas. Speaking of that, they would make nice, inexpensive gifts. Who knows? Maybe Santa will put a pair in my stocking this Christmas eve.
summary: Great for cuddling up under a blanket, reading a book and drinking a cup of tea.

reviewText:
I was pretty happy with this necklace. I honestly did not fit around my neck as my neck is a bit thick, however it did fit. This necklace is not quite as high quality as it looks in the picture, more the quality of something you can get at a costume store. My biggest complaint is with the center stone which is just sewn into the lace and is a bit off center. It also seems to tangle easily with the chains, and it is very hard to keep it centered and untangled. This necklace would be great for something like a Halloween costume for a night, but if you are looking for something for everyday wear, or for a special occasion, this is most likely not going to be it.  All in all, I am happy with this purchase, and would not hesitate to buy from this seller in the future.

Oh my goodness it's cuter than I expected! I was worried that it wouldn't fit, but the clasp chain on the back makes it adjustable for all necks. The lace is real and well sewn (it won't be unravelling anytime soon), and the chains and brooch are actual metal, not plastic like I was afraid of.

I showed it to a friend and she immediately wanted the link to get one too.

This necklace is one of the prettier Victorian lace like chokers I've seen in awhile. The necklace itself is rather delicate in my opinion with its lace cutouts, chains and pendants. It also quite literally is a choker; as I must admit that the necklace is rather snug. When my item arrived; I must admit that I was beyond ecstatic, for me the shipping was not prime available and had a good couple of weeks wait time; which was perfectly fine. Considering it arrived two weeks ahead of schedule, I couldn't have been happier.
When I opened the package I found the necklace hanging/wrapped up around a piece of cardboard that showed it off wonderfully. At first glance there seems to be an extension chain hooked to a little hole at the bottom corner of the cardboard which couldn't have made me happier because I was worried about the necklace being too tight. Once I unwrapped the item, it became clear that there was no chain on the necklace itself to allow you to wear it as depicted in the item photos. What I thought was an extension chain turned out to be part of the necklace itself--unattached.
On closer inspection it also seemed that the chain was just clipped onto the cardboard because the connecting end was tightly closed, and the item was seemed highly protected in the package it came in; so any chance it was a shipping issue seems unlikely. Upon finding this issue I contacted the seller who was cordial enough to email me attachment instructions. To be honest, the attachment is straightforward and exactly what I expected it to be prior to a response. All that really needs to be done is twisting open the connecting chain just enough to slide it through the hook on the necklace, then closing it back up. Because I have strength issues in my hands, I required a pair of "needle pliers" to get the connecting chain closed again. To be safe I also clamped it with said pliers as tight as I could.
The necklace is to me, a bit on the delicate side so I use caution when handling it and the few times I've worn it (with absolutely no problems by the way). Because of this I also do not just let it hang from a necklace stand; instead I keep it pinned flat, or laying flat, or wrapped around the neck of the cardboard piece it came it so that the chains do not get tangled up or rip off. It is a rather stunning artsy piece to have especially considering just how hard it is to find such pieces.
